meanings.definition: A point at which parts of an artificial structure are joined.
meanings.sent1: The robot's arm had a strong joint where the metal pieces connected.
meanings.sent2: The bookshelf fell apart because the joints were not properly secured.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot had a joint that made it do a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: The joint between the two buildings formed a seamless connection.
meanings.sent5: The joint in the puzzle was the key to completing the picture.

meanings.definition: A place or part at which two or more things are joined.
meanings.sent1: The bridge collapsed at the joint where the two sections met.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter carefully glued the joint of the wooden pieces together.
meanings.sent3: The joint between the two ropes created a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: The joint of the necklace sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The joint of the pipes leaked water onto the floor.

meanings.definition: A piece of meat roasted, especially a piece of meat on the bone.
meanings.sent1: The chef served a delicious joint of beef for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered around the table to enjoy the roasted joint of lamb.
meanings.sent3: The oversized joint of chicken made everyone at the table laugh.
meanings.sent4: The golden-brown joint of pork was the highlight of the meal.
meanings.sent5: The savory aroma of the roasted joint filled the kitchen.
